meta.description: Ideas for discovering and cataloging Talon Voice resources for awesome-talon

research_strategies.idea: Search GitHub for repos with .talon files using language:Talon filter
research_strategies.notes: Did this in initial pass, found ~100 repos

research_strategies.idea: Search GitHub topics: talonvoice, talon-voice, talon-scripts
research_strategies.notes: Did this in initial pass, found ~200 total repos across all searches

research_strategies.idea: Scrape the talon.wiki educational resources page for links
research_strategies.notes: Found YouTube channels, practice sites, cheatsheets, all added to README

research_strategies.idea: Search Hacker News for Talon Voice discussions and linked resources
research_strategies.notes: Found Numen, Caster, Kaldi Active Grammar, academic papers, Medium articles, Michael Tsai blog post, Addy Osmani article. All added.

research_strategies.idea: Search Reddit r/talon, r/accessibility, r/vim for Talon discussions
research_strategies.notes: Searched but found nothing unique beyond what we already have. Hardware recommendations verified via Talon wiki hardware page.

research_strategies.idea: Look at other awesome-* repos for structural inspiration
research_strategies.notes: Studied awesome-neovim and sindresorhus/awesome guidelines. Applied: CC0 license, better categorization with subcategories, table of contents, contribution guidelines.

research_strategies.idea: Check VS Code Marketplace for Talon-related extensions
research_strategies.notes: Found pokey.cursorless and pokey.talon marketplace extensions. Added to README.

research_strategies.idea: Search for Talon-related npm packages, PyPI packages
research_strategies.notes: Found gaze-ocr, screen-ocr, kaldi-active-grammar, vosk on PyPI. Added screen-ocr to README. Others already covered.

research_strategies.idea: Look at the talonhub org on GitHub for all repos
research_strategies.notes: Found talonhub/community-beta. Added to README.

research_strategies.idea: Search for Dragon NaturallySpeaking to Talon migration guides
research_strategies.notes: The KnowBrainer forum thread found suggests there's migration content out there

research_strategies.idea: Search YouTube for recent Talon demos and tutorials (2024-2026)
research_strategies.notes: Newer content may show off latest features like parrot, deck()

research_strategies.idea: Look at GitHub stars/following patterns - who stars talon repos? What else do they star?
research_strategies.notes: Cross-pollination discovery. Could use gh api to find stargazers of cursorless/community and check their repos.

research_strategies.idea: Search for Talon on Twitter/X for shared resources and demos
research_strategies.notes: lunixbochs posts updates there. Already found conformer demo tweet.

research_strategies.idea: Check alternative voice control tools that integrate with Talon

research_strategies.idea: Search for eye tracker hardware reviews/guides relevant to Talon users

research_strategies.idea: Look at what other awesome repos do for quality signals
research_strategies.notes: Decided to keep clean format without badges.

research_strategies.idea: Search for Talon on dev.to, Medium, and other blogging platforms
research_strategies.notes: No dev.to articles found. Medium article by Mikael Ainalem added. Addy Osmani Substack added.

research_strategies.idea: Check if there are any Talon-related browser bookmarklets or userscripts

research_strategies.idea: Search for academic papers about voice-driven development and Talon

research_strategies.idea: Check for Talon-related VS Code themes/icon packs

research_strategies.idea: Search for Talon Conformer model info
